alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:41AM EDT until July 28 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Harrison KY County in central Kentucky... * Until 600 AM EDT. * At 341 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported flood waters are beginning to recede. Some roads could remain closed or impassable, especially near low water crossings. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Breckinridge, Berry, Renaker, Colemansville, Robinson, Rutland, Boyd, Garnett, Connersville and Kelat. This includes the following streams and drainages... Richland Creek, Stratton Branch, Crooked Creek, Mill Creek, North Rays Fork, Raven Creek, Hall Branch, Rankin Branch, South Fork Twin Creek, Jacks Branch, Middle Fork Raven Creek, South Rays Fork, Pigeon Branch, Straight Fork, South Fork Raven Creek, Twin Creek, Little Mill Creek and North Fork Twin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
